title: Package Microsoft.Build error
body:
Hi
I downloaded 
https://github.com/jorgenschumann/InitialEnterprise
Which I think is a good example of Domain-Driven Design when compiling app build errors occur

sample error out of 24
Severity	Code	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
Error	NU1202	Package Microsoft.Build 15.3.409 is not compatible with netcoreapp2.1 (.NETCoreApp,Version=v2.1). Package Microsoft.Build 15.3.409 does not support any target frameworks.	React.Frontend	C:\Users\liudm\Downloads\CQRS\InitialEnterprise-master\Frontend\InitialEnterprise.Frontend\InitialEnterprise.MainFrontend\React.Frontend.csproj	1	
Error	NU1202	Package Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Core 15.3.409 is not compatible with netcoreapp2.1 (.NETCoreApp,Version=v2.1). Package Microsoft.Build.Utilities.Core 15.3.409 does not support any target frameworks.	React.Frontend	
C:\Users\liudm\Downloads\CQRS\InitialEnterprise-master\Frontend\InitialEnterprise.Frontend\InitialEnterprise.MainFrontend\React.Frontend.csproj	1	

Error	NU1202	Package Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives 2.0.0 is not compatible with netcoreapp2.1 (.NETCoreApp,Version=v2.1). Package Microsoft.Extensions.Primitives 2.0.0 does not support any target frameworks.	React.Frontend	C:\Users\liudm\Downloads\CQRS\InitialEnterprise-master\Frontend\InitialEnterprise.Frontend\InitialEnterprise.MainFrontend\React.Frontend.csproj	1	

There are a number of project samples currently investigating have similar issues, specific EquinoxProject-master 

If my memory serves me correctly EquinoxProject-master didn't generate any errors until I had restored windows.


Action take:-
	Repaired VS 2017
	Searched Solution with notepad++ Microsoft.Build which highlighted all projects had 
	Microsoft.Build.Tasks.Core, Version=15.1.0.0
	InitialEnterprise-master\Frontend\InitialEnterprise.Frontend\InitialEnterprise.BlazorFrontend\Blazor.Frontend\obj\Debug\netstandard2.0\Blazor.Frontend.csprojAssemblyReference.cache
	
	But where the 24 error occured in CQRS\InitialEnterprise-master\Frontend\InitialEnterprise.Frontend\InitialEnterprise.MainFrontend
	
No reference to the above (Microsoft.Build) were found,  vs 2017 looked for the best match most prob
	
	Any advise you can offer, would be helpful
	
	Kind regards
	Peter

nodes.body:
sorry missing entry in the cache file might be the issue, how can i regenerate or and add
Package Microsoft.Build
I am not sure which cache file are you referring to. Is this something that you are still facing?
Team triage: closing due to age. If you're still seeing this problem, please let us know and we can reactivate it.
